instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1398 3332-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an A1398 820-3332-A that has no power.

It pulls 100mA from bench PSU, I have green light on the charger, but no power or fan spin.

All Vcore voltages are missing.

Can you help?

threads.title: A1398 3332-A no power
threads.message:
What voltages do you get in power on sequence?
Detect something on the big coils?

threads.title: A1398 3332-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

I get all states of PP3 and PP5 and PP1V8 correctly.

On the big coils (CPU and GPU) I don't get any voltages

threads.title: A1398 3332-A no power
threads.message:
Please, list coils and voltages.
No idea if you get DDR and PCH voltage, for example.

threads.title: A1398 3332-A no power
threads.message:
Be sure to check all voltages properly; output pin of the coils.
L7330 should be 1.5V.

L7100 should get voltage, if PVCCSA_EN is present; comes from PM_SLP_S3_L (present for sure).

threads.title: A1398 3332-A no power
threads.message:
On  PVCCSA_EN I get 3.259V (read on R7987), but on L7100 I iget 0.012V on both pins.

On  L7330 I get:
Pin 1 = 1.354V
Pin 2 = 1.345V

threads.title: A1398 3332-A no power
threads.message:
Any idea about resistance to ground at L7100?
Compare with good board.
Post U7100 nasic voltages; pins 19, 20, 15.
Check R/C7130.

threads.title: A1398 3332-A no power
threads.message:
L7100 has 5.4 ohm resistance to ground (not sure if the value is ok, because I don't have a working board here).

U7100:
19 = 5.036V
20 = 5.039V
15 = 3.259V
16 = 0V

R/C1730 looks OK. However, on C7130, I have 4.716V on pin1, and 0V on pin2.

threads.title: A1398 3332-A no power
threads.message:
Resistance to ground is good.
Change U7100.
Maybe need to change Q7100 too.

threads.title: A1398 3332-A no power
threads.message:
Hello,

I've replaced both  U7100 and Q7100 but stil doesn't power on.

threads.title: A1398 3332-A no power
threads.message: Still no voltage at L7100?

threads.title: A1398 3332-A no power
threads.message: L7100 has 0.038V on both pins, and Pin 16 of U7100 also has 0.038V

threads.title: A1398 3332-A no power
threads.message:
Check all components and traces related with U/L7100.
Pay atention to R7151/52 and R/C7130.

threads.title: A1398 3332-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

It was R7151 that was bad. After replacement, now it powers on. However, I only get image on the external monitor. I already tried a known good display, but no image.

threads.title: A1398 3332-A no power
threads.message:
Do you get 5V at J9000?
At least in the first few seconds, when hear the chime.
LCD_HPD must go high at same time.

threads.title: A1398 3332-A no power
threads.message:
I have 5V (PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD) on J9000, but  LCD_HPD is always at 0V

PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT = 0V

F9700= 12.56V

threads.title: A1398 3332-A no power
threads.message:
That is really srange; do you check at both pins of R9000?
PCH requires LCD_HPD signal high, to maintain LCD_PWR_EN.

threads.title: A1398 3332-A no power
threads.message:
Yes, I recheked again and I have 0V on R9000 (both pins) and on pin 9 of J9000
LCD_PWR_EN = 3.315V

threads.title: A1398 3332-A no power
threads.message: If LCD_HPD stays low, 5V should disappear from J9000 after few seconds.

threads.title: A1398 3332-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,
I don't understand but I'm sure that LCD_HPD stays at 0.001V and PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD stays at 5.026V on pins 28-30 of J9000

threads.title: A1398 3332-A no power
threads.message: Disconnect internal LCD and check if 5V disappear from J9000 after few seconds.

threads.title: A1398 3332-A no power
threads.message:
HI,

Without LCD connected (internal and external), I't started with 0V and after a few seconds riches 5V and stays at 5V (I've waited 30 seconds this time).

threads.title: A1398 3332-A no power
threads.message:
Check R9000 and FL9000-3.
Also check R9001-3.

Compare 5V LCD behavior with good working board.

threads.title: A1398 3332-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,
I don't have a working board like this to compare. Is there any other way?

R9000 is OK (0 ohm).
R9001 has 1M ohm
R9002-3 have 0.990M ohm

FL9000-3 seams to be OK, but I don't have any voltage on them.

threads.title: A1398 3332-A no power
threads.message:
Looks like PCH issue.
It should disable 5V LCD, if LCD_HPD stays low.
